title: What help do users need?: taxonomies for on-line information needs & access methods
proctitle: CHI '95: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: A. W. Roesler
authors.institution: Austin Systems Center, Schlumberger Well Services, 8311 North FM 620 Road, P.O. Box 200015, Austin, Texas

authors.name: S. G. McLellan
authors.institution: Austin Systems Center, Schlumberger Well Services, 8311 North FM 620 Road, P.O. Box 200015, Austin, Texas

references.text: Mayhew, D. J. (1992). Principles and Guidelines in Software User Interface Design, Englewood Cliffs: PTR Prentice Hall.

Elkerton, J., & Palmiter, S. L. (1989). Designing Help Systems Using the GOMS Model: An Information Retrieval Evaluation, Proceedings of the Human Factors Society 33rd Annual Meeting, 1989, pp. 281-85.
Duffy T. & others (1993). On Line Help: Design and Evaluation. Norwood: Ablex Publishing Corp.
Hill, W. C. (1993). A Wizard of Oz Study of Advice Giving and Following, Human-Computer Interaction, 1993, Vol. 8, pp. 57-81.
Hill, W. C., & Miller, J. R., (1988). Justified Advice: A Semi-Naturalistic Study of Advisory Strategies, CHI '88 Proceedings, May 1988, pp. 185-90, ACM.

Sondheimer, N. K., Relles, N. (1982). Human Factors and User Assistance in Interactive Computing Systems: An Introduction, IEEE Transactions of Systems, Man and Cybernetics, Vol. SMC-12 (March-April 1982), pp. 102-107.

Hartley, J. R., & Smith, M. (1988). Question answering and explanation giving in on-line help systems. Artificial intelligence and human learning: Intelligent computer-aided instruction (pp.338-360). London: Chapman and Hall.
Miyake, N., & Norman, D. A. (1979). To ask a question one must know enough to know what is not known. Journal of Verbal Learning and Verbal Behavior, 18, 357-364.
Sellen, A. & Nicol, A. (1990). Building user-centered on-line help. In B. Laurel (Ed.), The art of human-computer interface design (pp.143-154). Reading, MA: Addisoon-Wesley.
Robertson, S., & Swartz, M. (1988). Why do we ask ourselves questions? Questioning Exchange, 2, (1), pp. 47-51.
Harris, R. A., & Hosier, W. J. (1991). A Taxonomy of Online Information. Technical Communication, 1991, 38(2), pp. 197-209.
